etymologies: late 16th century: from French nomade, via Latin from Greek nomas, nomad- ‘roaming in search of pasture’, from the base of nemein ‘to pasture’

definitions: a member of a people having no permanent abode, and who travel from place to place to find fresh pasture for their livestock

examples.text: the withering of their grasslands forced the nomads of the Sahara to descend into the Nile valley
the nomads who roam the borderlands of Afghanistan
the Magyars were a nomad people of the steppes

shortDefinitions: member of people that travels from place to place to find fresh pasture for its animals

definitions: a person who does not stay long in the same place; a wanderer

examples.text: Dolly was a nomad who had finally taken root in Hawaii

shortDefinitions: person who does not stay long in same place
